first_reading.text:
[[Ac 16,22]]The crowd in Philippi joined in the attack on Paul and Silas, and the magistrates had them stripped and ordered them to be beaten with rods.
[[Ac 16,23]]After inflicting many blows on them, they threw them into prison and instructed the jailer to guard them securely.
[[Ac 16,24]]When he received these instructions, he put them in the innermost cell and secured their feet to a stake.
[[Ac 16,25]]About midnight, while Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God as the prisoners listened,
[[Ac 16,26]]there was suddenly such a severe earthquake that the foundations of the jail shook; all the doors flew open, and the chains of all were pulled loose.
[[Ac 16,27]]When the jailer woke up and saw the prison doors wide open, he drew (his) sword and was about to kill himself, thinking that the prisoners had escaped.
[[Ac 16,28]]But Paul shouted out in a loud voice, "Do no harm to yourself; we are all here."
[[Ac 16,29]]He asked for a light and rushed in and, trembling with fear, he fell down before Paul and Silas.
[[Ac 16,30]]Then he brought them out and said, "Sirs, what must I do to be saved?"
[[Ac 16,31]]And they said, "Believe in the Lord Jesus and you and your household will be saved."
[[Ac 16,32]]So they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to everyone in his house.
[[Ac 16,33]]He took them in at that hour of the night and bathed their wounds; then he and all his family were baptized at once.
[[Ac 16,34]]He brought them up into his house and provided a meal and with his household rejoiced at having come to faith in God.
first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles

psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Jn 16,5]]Jesus said to his disciples: "Now I am going to the one who sent me, and not one of you asks me, 'Where are you going?'
[[Jn 16,6]]But because I told you this, grief has filled your hearts.
[[Jn 16,7]]But I tell you the truth, it is better for you that I go. For if I do not go, the Advocate will not come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.
[[Jn 16,8]]And when he comes he will convict the world in regard to sin and righteousness and condemnation:
[[Jn 16,9]]sin, because they do not believe in me;
[[Jn 16,10]]righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you will no longer see me;
[[Jn 16,11]]condemnation, because the ruler of this world has been condemned."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
